title: At first, I feared to fight yasuo mains.
body:
But ever since I faced a pro Kled main...
I fight yasuo mains for emotional support.

replies.body: LMAO, I love this post and it's 100% true. Bad players complain about Yasuo. Good players know that Kled is the true OP champ.

> [{quoted}](name=mmoran5554,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=Qd0znjFH,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2019-09-30T14:29:19.203+0000)
>
> LMAO, I love this post and it's 100% true. Bad players complain about Yasuo. Good players know that Kled is the true OP champ.

Funny though how for almost an entire year kled was meh, he got healing debuff on q and everyone started saying he's op
to be fair, kled was never bad. He just got more popular with the buff and people started realising it

yes, because only one champ is allowed to be OP

???
Fun fact, like rock paper scissors, by the end of the game Yasuo will kill Kled.

> [{quoted}](name=Mokuto Bunshi,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=Qd0znjFH,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2019-09-30T15:57:00.868+0000)
>
> Fun fact, like rock paper scissors, by the end of the game Yasuo will kill Kled.

It's not about whether Yasuo can kill Kled. 
It's more about who's better for your team. I prefer Kled because he can roam easily to help with ganks and his ULT is a great asset to engage in team fights.

> [{quoted}](name=Mokuto Bunshi,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=Qd0znjFH,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2019-09-30T15:57:00.868+0000)
>
> Fun fact, like rock paper scissors, by the end of the game Yasuo will kill Kled.

Not with Randuins, tabi, and thornmail he won't.

Yasuo was busted with the old conq but now he shouldn't be able to duel most bruisers.
Okay, I agree with that, but unlike Yasuo, that means Kled would have to change from what he normally builds (he rarely builds thornmail and almost never thornmail AND randuins)

> [{quoted}](name=Mokuto Bunshi,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=Qd0znjFH,comment-id=000200010000,timestamp=2019-10-03T15:44:15.592+0000)
>
> Okay, I agree with that, but unlike Yasuo, that means Kled would have to change from what he normally builds (he rarely builds thornmail and almost never thornmail AND randuins)

And that's the point of items, to adapt your builds to the enemy. That change in build path means denying Yasuo what Yasuos always want to do.

They want to split spush with their strong late game and collapse onto teamfights, and being unable to 1v1 a Kled with Thornmail and Randuins means he is denied his power spikes and farm and Kled's ult allows him to collapse into teamfights much better while being significantly tankier than a Yasuo.

Yasuo is an annoying champ in lane no doubt, but bruisers are not a class category that usually struggle with Yasuo short of skillshot reliant bruisers like Illaoi/Darius (Yasuo can juke their stuff pretty well, it's just most of them are bad and claim Yasuo is countered by Darius when all he needs to do is E his Q and poke him down with tornadoes before engagements, plus massively outscaling him late).

Renekton alone completely thrashes Yasuo and does a far better job than Yasuo at what Yasuo is supposed to be good at (but ok, I'll grant Renekton is busted and due for nerfs).

IDK, I just find champions like Zed far worse than Yasuo. Way safer, stronger scaling, stronger burst, naturally builds BC+LDR whereas Yasuo is far more delayed in building those prior to IE+BT+greaves.

Kled is very easy to beat though. Don't fight him top lane, you'll always lose trades if he grabs you. Every time he does that just walk away and kite if you can, because you'll lose the trade immediately if you dont. This typically results in top lanes dying for FB, which I see very frequently. But if you fight him once his grab is on cd you can do plenty of damage. But before that, you should be constantly poking him down from a distance if possible. You'd think Nocturne would have it rough but Kled is easy to beat.

> [{quoted}](name=Nøctμrne,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=Qd0znjFH,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2019-09-30T16:40:21.170+0000)
>
> Kled is very easy to beat though. Don't fight him top lane, you'll always lose trades if he grabs you. Every time he does that just walk away and kite if you can, because you'll lose the trade immediately if you dont. This typically results in top lanes dying for FB, which I see very frequently. But if you fight him once his grab is on cd you can do plenty of damage. But before that, you should be constantly poking him down from a distance if possible. You'd think Nocturne would have it rough but Kled is easy to beat.

Nocturne does well into any champ that relies on landing one single skill. But even then if Kled rushes even a bit of armor Nocturne stands no chance by mid to late game.

Picking nocturne top is cutting the nose to spite the face. You've just denied your team a frontline like the same assholes who pick ranged top. And then the enemy team can freely dive your ADC and mages without much resistance unless your jungler and supp both picked CC tank champs.

Calm down, you don't understand itemization. You rush botrk and get cloth armor on first back, and you beat him all the way through late game. Nocturne is a very good front line, I just suicide into the enemy team to allow my team to get fed and scale later in the game, and I target the people in the back and pull focus to me. Sounds like you've had bad Nocturne's on your team. Knowing how to build Nocturne so he can front line and deal good damage is key. Check my match history.

Funny how people voted down my 1st response. But I see feeding/inting yasuo players all the time. I almost never see that from Kled players, they are usually reliable and strong.
Also look at statistics. **Kled has 50% win rate, but Yasuo only has 48% win rate.** 
That 2% may not seem like a big difference, until you consider the fact that MILLIONS of people play League of Legends. That 2% difference means Yasuo players are losing at least 2,000 or more games than Kled players.
